title: Gogglebox star George Gilbey jailed for drink-driving
text:
George Gilbey was found guilty (Picture: Channel 4)

Gogglebox star George Gilbey has been jailed for three months after being found guilty of drink-driving.

George was caught after staff at a filling station smelled alcohol on his breath.

The police were called and he was breathalysed, revealing he had been drinking nearly three times the legal limit.

He admitted the charge at Chelmsford Magistrates’ Court.

He will serve time in prison because he was serving a community punishment for a violent attack he carried out on his ex-girlfriend and the mother of his daughter.

He was serving a community punishment for a violent attack on his ex-girlfriend (Picture: Getty)

In 2018 he was spared prison and instead given a sentence of 100 hours unpaid work, 40 sessions of ‘rehabilitation activity’ as well as paying a total of £1,105, including compensation for the damage he caused in the attack.

Miss Conway also has a restraining order in place, preventing him from contacting her at her address.

George Gilbey found fame on Gogglebox (Picture: Channel 4)

Speaking in court Miss Conway spoke of the evening’s events following a drunk evening he had at the pub watching Cheltenham Races.

‘He lunged at me where I was sitting on the sofa. Put my arms up and he began to attack me with various objects in the room,’ she said.

‘He started throwing things at me the whole time, like my lamp, and candles. He ripped the child gate off the wall and started beating me with it.’

She added: ‘When the TV came at me that is when I thought I was in real trouble here and I said: “Please don’t leave my baby without her mum.”

‘At some point after that I must have blacked out. When I woke up the flat was quiet and I crawled towards the phone, which had all the buttons smashed in. I then searched for my mobile phone in the mess.’
